icp.what_they_sell: Commercial construction, renovation, tenant improvements, roofing, site services, and building inspection & maintenance.
icp.customer_industry: Commercial real estate developers, Retail chains expanding locations, Healthcare systems building new facilities, Hotel/hospitality companies developing new properties, Corporate headquarters relocations and renovations, Industrial facilities expanding or upgrading.
ideal_customer_characteristics: Actively developing or expanding real estate portfolio.
Has announced new location openings or expansions.
Requires specialized construction services like roofing or site work.
Values quality, integrity, and client satisfaction in a construction partner.
icp.customer_geography: Primarily within the states where they have completed projects.
avoid_company_types: Manufacturers with existing facilities (have in-house maintenance)

prospects.name: The Inland Real Estate Group of Companies, Inc.
prospects.why_good_fit: As a real estate developer, Inland would likely need commercial construction, renovation, and other related services for their development projects.
prospects.what_they_do: Inland is a vertically integrated commercial real estate investment, finance, and operating group that develops and manages commercial properties.

prospects.name: Greenberg Gibbons
prospects.why_good_fit: As a commercial real estate developer, they would likely need commercial construction, renovation, and related services for their projects.
prospects.what_they_do: Greenberg Gibbons is a commercial real estate developer, investor, and owner of commercial, mixed-use, residential, retail, and flex/R&D spaces.

prospects.name: Lincoln
prospects.why_good_fit: Lincoln engages in real estate development and redevelopment projects, making them a potential customer for commercial construction, renovation, and related services.
prospects.what_they_do: Lincoln is a global commercial real estate services and investment firm that provides services across the real estate lifecycle, including development and redevelopment projects.

prospects.name: Hudson
prospects.why_good_fit: Hudson is actively expanding and opening new stores in airports, which requires commercial construction, renovation, and tenant improvement services.
prospects.what_they_do: Hudson Group is a travel retailer that operates duty-paid and duty-free stores in airports and transportation hubs across North America.

prospects.name: Home Depot
prospects.why_good_fit: Home Depot is constantly expanding and renovating its retail locations, requiring commercial construction, renovation, and maintenance services.
prospects.what_they_do: Home Depot is a large retail chain specializing in home improvement and construction products and services.

prospects.name: Target
prospects.why_good_fit: As a large retail chain, Target frequently expands and renovates its stores, making them a potential customer for commercial construction, renovation, and related services.
prospects.what_they_do: Target is a general merchandise retailer offering a variety of products including apparel, home goods, food, and electronics.

prospects.name: Stream Realty Partners
prospects.why_good_fit: They offer development and construction management services, suggesting they could need subcontractors for specialized construction tasks like roofing or site services, or potentially building inspection & maintenance.
prospects.what_they_do: Stream Realty Partners is a commercial real estate firm offering services like development, construction management, and property management.

prospects.name: JLL India

prospects.what_they_do: JLL India provides commercial real estate services and property investment strategies, working with owners, tenants, and investors.

prospects.name: Walmart

prospects.what_they_do: Walmart is a multinational retail corporation that operates a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores.

prospects.what_they_do: Hy-Vee is a grocery store chain offering online ordering, pick-up, delivery, and various shopping services.
